intro: Aeschynanthus myrtifolius, commonly known as the red-veined orchid, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, velvety leaves with deep red veins. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically red or orange in color, often clustered in racemes. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated as a houseplant and in botanical gardens.
